items.title: Six takeaways from the Senate report on January 6 security failures
Keilar presses Democrat: Why didn't report call it an insurrection?
items.content: CNN's Brianna Keilar asks Sen. Gary Peters (D-MI), who chairs one of the committees behind a new Senate January 6 report, why the report on the security breaches during the Capitol riot did not call the event an insurrection.
items.contentSnippet: CNN's Brianna Keilar asks Sen. Gary Peters (D-MI), who chairs one of the committees behind a new Senate January 6 report, why the report on the security breaches during the Capitol riot did not call the event an insurrection.

items.title: 'We turned so far right we went crazy:' How Fox News was radicalized by its own viewers
items.content: This article is adapted from the new edition of "Hoax: Donald Trump, Fox News, and the Dangerous Distortion of Truth," which was published in paperback on Tuesday.

items.title: What we know so far about today's major internet outage
items.content: Countless websites and apps around the world went down Tuesday after Fastly, a major content delivery network, reported a widespread failure.
items.contentSnippet: Countless websites and apps around the world went down Tuesday after Fastly, a major content delivery network, reported a widespread failure.

items.title: CNN's Brian Stelter explains what happened with outage
items.content: A significant number of apps and websites around the world are down after Fastly, a content delivery network, reported a widespread failure. CNN's Brian Stelter has more.

items.title: The Giuliani Ukraine call makes Trump's 'perfect' call look even worse
Listen to the full 40-minute Giuliani phone call with a Ukrainian presidential aide
Mystery of the Uyghurs being deported from the Arab world
items.content: Amannisa Abdullah and her husband Ahmad Talip were on their way to shop for baby clothes in Dubai, when the message that changed both their lives came through. Ahmad read it and announced an abrupt change of plan: He had to report to a police station immediately.
items.contentSnippet: Amannisa Abdullah and her husband Ahmad Talip were on their way to shop for baby clothes in Dubai, when the message that changed both their lives came through. Ahmad read it and announced an abrupt change of plan: He had to report to a police station immediately.

items.title: The scariest thing Obama told Anderson Cooper
items.content: In an interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper on Monday night, former President Barack Obama admitted that our democracy isn't something that we should just assume will always be there.
items.contentSnippet: In an interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper on Monday night, former President Barack Obama admitted that our democracy isn't something that we should just assume will always be there.

items.title: Ratko Mladic, the 'butcher of Bosnia,' loses appeal against genocide conviction
items.content: Former Bosnian Serb army leader Ratko Mladic, nicknamed "the butcher of Bosnia," will have to serve his life sentence after an appeal against his war crimes convictions was rejected on Tuesday.
items.contentSnippet: Former Bosnian Serb army leader Ratko Mladic, nicknamed "the butcher of Bosnia," will have to serve his life sentence after an appeal against his war crimes convictions was rejected on Tuesday.

items.title: London police officer pleads guilty to kidnap and rape of Sarah Everard
items.content: A London Metropolitan Police officer has pleaded guilty to the kidnap and rape of Sarah Everard, a 33-year old woman who disappeared while walking in south London in March, the PA news agency reported Tuesday.
items.contentSnippet: A London Metropolitan Police officer has pleaded guilty to the kidnap and rape of Sarah Everard, a 33-year old woman who disappeared while walking in south London in March, the PA news agency reported Tuesday.

items.title: French President Emmanuel Macron slapped by member of public
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron was slapped in the face by a man in a crowd as he spoke to the public during a visit to southeast France on Tuesday, video of the incident posted on social media showed.
items.contentSnippet: French President Emmanuel Macron was slapped in the face by a man in a crowd as he spoke to the public during a visit to southeast France on Tuesday, video of the incident posted on social media showed.

items.title: Ocasio-Cortez calls out Kamala Harris after speech
items.content: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) criticized Vice President Kamala Harris' speech in Guatemala where she told potential migrants "don't come" to the US.
items.contentSnippet: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) criticized Vice President Kamala Harris' speech in Guatemala where she told potential migrants "don't come" to the US.

items.title: Keira Knightley says all the women she knows have been sexually harassed
items.content: Keira Knightley has said that every woman she knows has been subjected to sexual harassment, from being flashed to groped, including herself.
items.contentSnippet: Keira Knightley has said that every woman she knows has been subjected to sexual harassment, from being flashed to groped, including herself.

items.title: They survived one of the worst school shootings in American history. Now they're graduating.
items.content: They both fidget while they talk, like any teenager would when being questioned in front of multiple cameras. One jokes about her imperfect manicure. The other adjusts her necklace that says "Misery."
items.contentSnippet: They both fidget while they talk, like any teenager would when being questioned in front of multiple cameras. One jokes about her imperfect manicure. The other adjusts her necklace that says "Misery."

items.title: Salvadoran woman freed from jail after 30-year abortion sentence
items.content: A Salvadoran woman who had served nearly a third of her 30-year prison sentence on charges of terminating her pregnancy and violating El Salvador's harsh abortion ban was released on Monday, activists said.
items.contentSnippet: A Salvadoran woman who had served nearly a third of her 30-year prison sentence on charges of terminating her pregnancy and violating El Salvador's harsh abortion ban was released on Monday, activists said.

items.title: Central America's migration problem isn't going away anytime soon
items.content: It is best to get permission from local gang leaders before entering a small neighborhood that locals call La Playita in Chamelecón, Honduras. Violence here is as pervasive as the poverty in this area, and strangers aren't generally welcome.
items.contentSnippet: It is best to get permission from local gang leaders before entering a small neighborhood that locals call La Playita in Chamelecón, Honduras. Violence here is as pervasive as the poverty in this area, and strangers aren't generally welcome.

items.title: Drone refuels US Navy jet for first time
items.content: New footage released from the US Navy shows an unmanned drone refueling with another fighter jet.
items.contentSnippet: New footage released from the US Navy shows an unmanned drone refueling with another fighter jet.

items.title: Harris rejects criticism over lack of border visit: 'And I haven't been to Europe'
items.content: Vice President Kamala Harris pushed back on criticism that she hasn't visited the US-Mexico border in an interview aired on Tuesday by arguing that her travel has been limited during the early days of the Biden administration.
items.contentSnippet: Vice President Kamala Harris pushed back on criticism that she hasn't visited the US-Mexico border in an interview aired on Tuesday by arguing that her travel has been limited during the early days of the Biden administration.

items.title: Corporate America promised to get more diverse. But it's still mostly White women making gains
items.content: The level of diversity on America's biggest corporate boards has never been higher. But it's still far from on par with what US society looks like.
items.contentSnippet: The level of diversity on America's biggest corporate boards has never been higher. But it's still far from on par with what US society looks like.

items.title: Three Colorado gun measures in response to Boulder shooting are close to becoming law
items.content: A series of gun measures in Colorado that were prompted by the mass shooting in Boulder in March are close to becoming law.
items.contentSnippet: A series of gun measures in Colorado that were prompted by the mass shooting in Boulder in March are close to becoming law.

items.title: Deadly flooding and landslides hit Sri Lanka
items.content: Monsoon rains turn deadly for Sri Lanka, where rain totals for 24 hours exceeded the normal values for the whole month of June.  CNN Meteorologist Karen Maginnis has the details.
items.contentSnippet: Monsoon rains turn deadly for Sri Lanka, where rain totals for 24 hours exceeded the normal values for the whole month of June.  CNN Meteorologist Karen Maginnis has the details.

items.title: The stock market after-party is in Europe
items.content: US stock indices remain in record territory. But in recent weeks, they've been stuck in a holding pattern as investors hunt for the next big catalyst that could send shares higher.
items.contentSnippet: US stock indices remain in record territory. But in recent weeks, they've been stuck in a holding pattern as investors hunt for the next big catalyst that could send shares higher.

items.title: For years, the underworld thought its phones were safe. They fell for an encrypted app trap
items.content: It was supposed to be the underworld's impenetrable communication tool, a digital safe space to plot crimes ranging from drug trafficking to murder away from the prying eyes of the law.
items.contentSnippet: It was supposed to be the underworld's impenetrable communication tool, a digital safe space to plot crimes ranging from drug trafficking to murder away from the prying eyes of the law.

items.title: Lawmaker twists MLK Jr.'s words to deny systemic racism in US
items.content: CNN's Don Lemon talks to Peniel Joseph, Professor of History at the University of Texas and author of "The Sword and the Shield: The Revolutionary Lives of Malcolm X and Martin Luther King Jr.", about Sen. Ron Johnson (R-WI) mentioning Martin Luther King Jr. when saying critical race theory shouldn't be taught in American schools.

items.title: Debbie Hewitt set to become first female chair of England's Football Association
items.content: Debbie Hewitt is set to become the first female chair of England's Football Association (FA) in the organization's 157-year history.
items.contentSnippet: Debbie Hewitt is set to become the first female chair of England's Football Association (FA) in the organization's 157-year history.

items.title: Romelu Lukaku says racism in football is at an 'all-time high'
items.content: Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku believes racism in football is at an "all-time high" ahead of the start of the European Championships.
items.contentSnippet: Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku believes racism in football is at an "all-time high" ahead of the start of the European Championships.

items.title: Texas mom poses as 13-year-old daughter in school
items.content: Mom attends 7th grade posing as her 13-year-old daughter to test school security. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports the school flunked.
items.contentSnippet: Mom attends 7th grade posing as her 13-year-old daughter to test school security. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports the school flunked.

items.title: Mastercard Foundation and Africa CDC announce $1.3 billion vaccine initiative
items.content: The Mastercard Foundation and the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) will deploy $1.3 billion over the next three years as part of a new initiative to acquire and deliver vaccines across the continent.
items.contentSnippet: The Mastercard Foundation and the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) will deploy $1.3 billion over the next three years as part of a new initiative to acquire and deliver vaccines across the continent.

items.title: Teen who wore Mexican flag at graduation gets the diploma he was denied at the ceremony
items.content: When Ever López walked across the stage at his North Carolina high school graduation, he became the first of his immediate family to graduate high school.
items.contentSnippet: When Ever López walked across the stage at his North Carolina high school graduation, he became the first of his immediate family to graduate high school.

items.title: See kids 'brilliantly' recreate CNN story about Kenya's conservation efforts

items.title: Can China still lead the world in tech without a new Jack Ma?
items.content: China has cut its global tech champions down to size, cracking down on antitrust abuses and undue risk taking. But the heavy-handed approach could backfire on Beijing by stifling an entrepreneurial spirit that has proven vital to the country's rapid economic rise.
items.contentSnippet: China has cut its global tech champions down to size, cracking down on antitrust abuses and undue risk taking. But the heavy-handed approach could backfire on Beijing by stifling an entrepreneurial spirit that has proven vital to the country's rapid economic rise.

items.title: Biden task force prepares to reunite 29 migrant families separated at border under Trump
items.content: The Biden administration is preparing to reunite 29 migrant families who were separated at the US-Mexico border under then-President Donald Trump's controversial "zero tolerance" immigration policy, according to a newly released report.
items.contentSnippet: The Biden administration is preparing to reunite 29 migrant families who were separated at the US-Mexico border under then-President Donald Trump's controversial "zero tolerance" immigration policy, according to a newly released report.

items.title: Boeing's latest challenge: China
items.content: The Boeing 737 Max is back in the air, and air travel is finally rebounding, helping restart orders for new planes. But Boeing is still facing a major problem that could cripple the company for years to come — US-China trade tensions.
items.contentSnippet: The Boeing 737 Max is back in the air, and air travel is finally rebounding, helping restart orders for new planes. But Boeing is still facing a major problem that could cripple the company for years to come — US-China trade tensions.

items.title: Herd of wandering elephants takes nap after 500km trek
items.content: Aerial footage shows a herd of elephants resting after they trekked 500 km (310 miles) north from a nature reserve in south China. The reason for their migration is not known.
items.contentSnippet: Aerial footage shows a herd of elephants resting after they trekked 500 km (310 miles) north from a nature reserve in south China. The reason for their migration is not known.

items.title: JetTrain: The high-speed dream that never took off
items.content: It may have some of the world's longest railroads, covering vast distances across its wide-open provinces, but one thing Canada doesn't have is a high-speed trains.
items.contentSnippet: It may have some of the world's longest railroads, covering vast distances across its wide-open provinces, but one thing Canada doesn't have is a high-speed trains.

items.title: Scientists confirm discovery of Australia's largest dinosaur, two stories tall and a basketball court long
items.content: A new species of dinosaur discovered in Australia has been confirmed as the largest ever found in the country, and one of the biggest in the world.
items.contentSnippet: A new species of dinosaur discovered in Australia has been confirmed as the largest ever found in the country, and one of the biggest in the world.

items.title: Watch sinkhole swallow up parked cars in Jerusalem
items.content: A sinkhole that opened up in the parking lot outside a hospital in Jerusalem has swallowed up several parked cars. No injuries were reported after police investigated the site.
items.contentSnippet: A sinkhole that opened up in the parking lot outside a hospital in Jerusalem has swallowed up several parked cars. No injuries were reported after police investigated the site.

items.title: These innovative designs are tackling taboo health issues for women
items.content: A non-hormonal birth control capsule that women can insert just before sex. A rape kit that gives victims more agency and streamlines the evidence collection process. An overhauled design for a 150-year-old tool used in postpartum vaginal tearing.
items.contentSnippet: A non-hormonal birth control capsule that women can insert just before sex. A rape kit that gives victims more agency and streamlines the evidence collection process. An overhauled design for a 150-year-old tool used in postpartum vaginal tearing.

items.title: A 'Bubble Barrier' is trapping plastic waste before it can get into the sea
items.content: What do old televisions, street signs, motorbike helmets, windsurf  boards, and Christmas trees have in common? They were all caught floating down Amsterdam's Westerdok canal -- by a curtain of bubbles.
items.contentSnippet: What do old televisions, street signs, motorbike helmets, windsurf  boards, and Christmas trees have in common? They were all caught floating down Amsterdam's Westerdok canal -- by a curtain of bubbles.

items.title: Are you a night owl or morning lark? One may protect you from depression, study says
items.content: Do you bounce out of bed early in the morning full of zest and ready to go? Or do you slap the snooze alarm until the last possible second and drag your tired body to work?

items.title: It's easy to sell a home these days. The catch is you have to find another one to buy
items.content: This is the best time to sell a home in 20 years. Inventory is near all-time lows and home prices are at peak levels. Even the most 'ho-hum' homes are getting multiple offers and selling lightening fast.
items.contentSnippet: This is the best time to sell a home in 20 years. Inventory is near all-time lows and home prices are at peak levels. Even the most 'ho-hum' homes are getting multiple offers and selling lightening fast.

items.title: People with diabetes who sleep badly are at greater risk of dying prematurely, study suggests
items.content: People with diabetes who had trouble falling or staying asleep were 87% more likely to die of any cause over the next nine years than people without diabetes or sleep problems, a new study finds.
items.contentSnippet: People with diabetes who had trouble falling or staying asleep were 87% more likely to die of any cause over the next nine years than people without diabetes or sleep problems, a new study finds.

items.title: Ford enters the little pickup truck war with the new hybrid Maverick
items.content: Ford is famous for its huge F-150 pickup, America's best-selling truck. But now, with the release of its new Maverick compact pickup, which will be available as a front-wheel-drive hybrid, it's seeking to prove that it can rule in the growing market for little trucks as well
items.contentSnippet: Ford is famous for its huge F-150 pickup, America's best-selling truck. But now, with the release of its new Maverick compact pickup, which will be available as a front-wheel-drive hybrid, it's seeking to prove that it can rule in the growing market for little trucks as well

items.title: Investigators found Capitol Police were warned and other embarrassing crunch-time failures. This report isn't even the full story.
items.content: Two Senate committees on Tuesday released the most comprehensive government report on the security failures leading up to the US Capitol insurrection on January 6, revealing new details about unheeded warnings, critical miscommunications and intelligence shortcomings.
items.contentSnippet: Two Senate committees on Tuesday released the most comprehensive government report on the security failures leading up to the US Capitol insurrection on January 6, revealing new details about unheeded warnings, critical miscommunications and intelligence shortcomings.
